title: (x) Pistilli/Motter-esque type used for Bluegrass Unlimited logo - Stilla {Richard Hards}
content:
Anybody have any ideas? I’m really loving the E and A, the G, the S, the B, L, U and R as well...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080919072403im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bluegrass_5677.jpg)

 [‹ (x) British movie magazine Sight & Sound logo - PMN Caecilia {Patricia}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080919072403/http:/typophile.com/node/38243 "Go to previous forum topic") [Looking for a baseball style script font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080919072403/http:/typophile.com/node/38202 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dcastillo

comments.content:
[Stilla](http://web.archive.org/web/20080919072403/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=stilla&site=d&sample_text=BLUEGRASS&sample_size=48)

EDIT: I see the edit time-shifting bug is still around then!

I was even looking at this on FontShop a couple months back. I suppose it takes a real-world connection to retain these things.

But speaking of FontShop, I notice Scangraphic often has a lot of these unique typefaces for a fraction of the price. How does the quality match up to competitors such as Elsner+Flake?

I think the quality is still good, just slightly different digitizations. Incidentally, E+F isn’t much of a competitor because they now own Scangraphic.

Incidentally again, Anna and I reviewed Stilla for [Printmag.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080919072403/http:/printmag.com/design_articles/HotTypeStilla/tabid/260/Default.aspx) last month.
